N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 150.1 - Institutional reports

State Regulations

Nonpublic institutions of higher education which apply for

State aid pursuant to section
6401
of the

Education Law shall submit the following information in a manner prescribed by
the commissioner: (a) a report of
opening fall enrollment by November 1st of each year and a comprehensive report
on enrollment by November 30th; (b) a report of institutional faculty and staff by November 1st of each
year; (c) an annual certified audit
report within 100 days after the close of the institution's fiscal
year; (d) general financial report
for the preceding fiscal year not later than three months after the close of
the institution's fiscal year; (e) a copy of the summary budget of the institution for the ensuing fiscal year by

July 1st of each year; (f) a report
on the inventory and use of physical facilities by November 30th of each
year; (g) a report on library
resources by October 1st of each year; (h) a statement of long-range plans in
relation to such matters as institutional objectives, programs, enrollment, staffing, degrees, facilities and financing, together with a report of progress
in implementing such plans by August 1st of each year; (i) a statement with respect to the
administrative practices and procedures of the institution whenever required by
the commissioner; (j) a
certification of the number of earned bachelor's, master' s and doctoral
degrees conferred by the institution and, by the two-year institutions only, the number of earned associate degrees conferred, during the 12-month period
ending on the preceding June 30th, and shall submit, in addition, an estimate
of the number of such degrees to be granted during each of the next two
succeeding 12-month periods beginning July 1st. Such reports shall be submitted
by August 15th of each year; and
(k) a statement, to be submitted by September
1st of each year by each institution which has received apportionment of State
aid, setting forth the ways in which the funds so apportioned during the
12-month period ending on the preceding June 30th have assisted the institution
in achieving its objectives. Notes
